economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over small payments and alms. Accused was destitute beggar who could no longer work due to disabled hands ('perclus'). Disputes included: refusal to give money for wheat (witness 11), collection of sol for 'rolbes' from daughter (witness 9), disputes over sharing alms with fellow beggars. Economic desperation evident throughout.

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony. Key uncertainties: (1) Exact date sequence unclear for some interrogations - July 19 interrogation appears in text after August 10 but dated earlier; placed chronologically in timeline. (2) Relationship between 'Mengeotte' and 'Mengette' naming - appears to be variant spellings of same person (accused). (3) The confrontation with Janne veuve Nicolas Vincent is dated July 24, but her testimony appears after August 6 material - may be documentation order rather than chronological. (4) No explicit formal accuser (partie formelle) named; procureur général Maimbourg appears to be acting on behalf of community. (5) Economic status assessed as 'destitute' based on: begging, disabled hands preventing work, husband abandoned her, living in others' houses, disputes over tiny sums. (6) Healing practices documented: used herbs for bathing/healing sergent, claimed ability to heal by touch, went on pilgrimage to heal child. (7) Language region: French-speaking area (German mentioned only as foreign language butcher used to warn wife). (8) Multiple children deaths follow similar pattern: touch by accused after dispute/refusal, rapid illness, death within days to weeks. (9) Confession obtained under torture follows exact pattern of witness testimony - 'led through the evidence' as document notes. (10) Change de Nancy consulted twice: once for torture approval, once for death sentence approval.
